text: transportationlong caricatured as ratchet-jawing diesel cowboys who 10-4 each other on cb radios, more truckers are turning to the web to keep in touch. sensing a trend, volvo trucks north america will offer a data-friendly version of its 770 semitrailer, complete with the first weather-protected exterior data port, later this year.marketed as "a seamless telecommunications and internet connectivity solution," the port is located just beneath the sleeper in the cab. interior wiring links the exterior connection to both a phone jack and a cable tv hookup in the rig's "dinette-office center."jack-ins are available via bollards, miniature speed-bump-like thingamajigs found at most truck stops. currently, wired truckers have to thread their cables through a partially opened window or door - an inconvenience during cold or wet weather and a security risk to boot - but with the new volvo 770, gearjammers can pull in to the pickle park, pop a bollard, plug in, and log on to e*trade in the comfort and security of a locked truck.must readsputterniktired/wiredgood dealas the well turnsall's well that ends wellsmarter bombbattlefield of tomorrowpass it onfashion policewhy buy retail?paranoia technologytailor-made medspeoplejargon watchpersonality typingcustomize or diesailing the red skiesgrubstake grillt1, good buddyraw data
